meanings.definition: A peculiar behavioral habit or mannerism.
meanings.sent1: Her quirk of tapping her foot when nervous was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His quirk of always wearing mismatched socks made him stand out.
meanings.sent3: The quirk of humming while eating soup made the dinner table more musical.
meanings.sent4: His quirk of collecting rubber ducks was as unique as it was endearing.
meanings.sent5: The quirk of always carrying a lucky charm made her unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The road took a sharp quirk to the left, surprising the driver.
meanings.sent2: The plot of the movie had a sudden quirk that changed everything.
meanings.sent3: The quirk in the story made the ending unexpected and exciting.
meanings.sent4: His life took a quirk when he decided to move to a new city.
meanings.sent5: The quirk in the path led them to a hidden garden.

meanings.sent1: Her quirk of always wearing a hat added to her unique style.
meanings.sent2: His quirk of being able to recite movie quotes from memory impressed his friends.
meanings.sent3: The quirk of having a fear of clowns was both amusing and understandable.
meanings.sent4: The quirk of having a photographic memory was like having a superpower.
meanings.sent5: The quirk of always carrying a notebook to jot down ideas was inspiring.
